Event.name: CursorClose
Event.description: A cursor previously opened on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library is closed.

Event.name: CursorExecute
Event.description: A cursor previously prepared on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library is executed.

Event.name: CursorImplicitConversion
Event.description: A cursor on a Transact-SQL statement is converted by SQL Server from one type to another. Triggered for ANSI and non-ANSI cursors.

Event.name: CursorOpen
Event.description: Indicates when a cursor is opened on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library.

Event.name: CursorPrepare
Event.description: Indicates when a cursor on a Transact-SQL statement is prepared for use by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library.

Event.name: CursorUnprepare
Event.description: A prepared cursor on a Transact-SQL statement is unprepared (deleted) by ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library.

Event.name: CursorRecompile
Event.description: A cursor opened on a Transact-SQL statement by ODBC or DB-Library has been recompiled either directly or due to a schema change. Triggered for ANSI and non-ANSI cursors.

Event.name: Attention
Event.description: Occurs when attention events, such as client-interrupt requests or broken client connections, happen.

Event.name: ErrorLog
Event.description: Indicates that error events have been logged in the SQL Server error log.

Event.name: EventLog
Event.description: Indicates that events have been logged in the Microsoft Windows NT application log.

Event.name: Exception
Event.description: Indicates that an exception has occurred in SQL Server.

Event.name: Execution Warnings
Event.description: Indicates any warnings that occurred during the execution of a SQL Server statement or stored procedure.

Event.name: Hash Warning
Event.description: Indicates that a hashing operation (for example, hash join, hash aggregate, hash union, and hash distinct) that is not processing on a buffer partition has reverted to an alternate plan. This can occur because of recursion depth, data skew, trace flags, or bit counting.

Event.name: Missing Column Statistics
Event.description: Column statistics that could have been useful for the optimizer are not available.

Event.name: Missing Join Predicate
Event.description: Query that has no join predicate is being executed. This could result in a long-running query.

Event.name: OLE DB Errors
Event.description: Indicates that an OLE DB error has occurred.

Event.name: Sort Warnings
Event.description: Indicates sort operations that do not fit into memory. Does not include sort operations involving the creating of indexes; only sort operations within a query (such as an ORDER BY clause used in a SELECT statement).

Event.name: Lock:Acquired
Event.description: Indicates acquisition of a lock on a resource, such as a data page.

Event.name: Lock:Cancel
Event.description: Indicates that the acquisition of a lock on a resource has been canceled (for example, due to a deadlock).

Event.name: Lock:Deadlock
Event.description: Indicates that two concurrent transactions have deadlocked each other by trying to obtain incompatible locks on resources the other transaction owns.

Event.name: Lock:Deadlock Chain
Event.description: Produced for each of the events leading up to the deadlock.

Event.name: Lock:Escalation
Event.description: Indicates that a finer-grained lock has been converted to a coarser-grained lock (for example, a row lock escalated or converted to a page lock).

Event.name: Lock:Released
Event.description: Indicates that a lock on a resource, such as a page, has been released.

Event.name: Lock:Timeout
Event.description: Indicates that a request for a lock on a resource, such as a page, has timed out due to another transaction holding a blocking lock on the required resource. Time-out is determined by the @@LOCK_TIMEOUT function, and can be set with the SET LOCK_TIMEOUT statement.

Event.name: Auto Update Stats
Event.description: Indicates an automatic updating of index statistics has occurred.

Event.name: Object:Closed
Event.description: Indicates that an object has been closed.

Event.name: Object:Created
Event.description: Indicates that an object has been created, such as for CREATE INDEX, CREATE TABLE, and CREATE DATABASE statements.

Event.name: Object:Deleted
Event.description: Indicates that an object has been deleted, such as in DROP INDEX and DROP TABLE statements.

Event.name: Object:Opened
Event.description: Indicates that an object has been opened.

Event.name: Degree of Parallelism (7.0 Delete)
Event.description: Occurs before a DELETE statement is executed.

Event.name: Degree of Parallelism (7.0 Insert)
Event.description: Occurs before an INSERT statement is executed.

Event.name: Degree of Parallelism (7.0 Select)
Event.description: Occurs before a SELECT statement is executed.

Event.name: Degree of Parallelism (7.0 Update)
Event.description: Occurs before an UPDATE statement is executed.

Event.name: Execution Plan
Event.description: Displays the plan tree of the Transact-SQL statement executed.

Event.name: Scan:Started
Event.description: Indicates when a table or index scan has started.

Event.name: Scan:Stopped
Event.description: Indicates when a table or index scan has stopped.

Event.name: Login
Event.description: Occurs when a user successfully logs in to SQL Server.

Event.name: Login Failed
Event.description: Indicates that a login attempt to SQL Server from a client failed.

Event.name: Logout
Event.description: Occurs when a user logs out of SQL Server.

Event.name: ServiceControl
Event.description: Occurs when the SQL Server service state is modified.

Event.name: Server Memory Change
Event.description: Microsoft SQL Server memory usage has increased or decreased by either 1 megabyte (MB) or 5 percent of the maximum server memory, whichever is greater.

Event.name: ExistingConnection
Event.description: Detects all activity by users connected to SQL Server before the trace started.

Event.name: RPC:Completed
Event.description: Occurs when a remote procedure call (RPC) has completed.

Event.name: RPC:Starting
Event.description: Occurs when an RPC has started.

Event.name: SP:CacheHit
Event.description: Indicates when a stored procedure is found in the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:CacheInsert
Event.description: Indicates when an item is inserted into the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:CacheMiss
Event.description: Indicates when a stored procedure is not found in the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:CacheRemove
Event.description: Indicates when an item is removed from the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:Completed
Event.description: Indicates when the stored procedure has completed.

Event.name: SP:ExecContextHit
Event.description: Indicates when the execution version of a stored procedure has been found in the procedure cache.

Event.name: SP:Recompile
Event.description: Indicates that a stored procedure was recompiled.

Event.name: SP:Starting
Event.description: Indicates when the stored procedure has started.

Event.name: SP:StmtCompleted
Event.description: Occurs when the stored procedure statement has completed.

Event.name: SP:StmtStarting
Event.description: Occurs when the stored procedure statement has started.

Event.name: DTCTransaction
Event.description: Tracks Microsoft Distributed Transaction Coordinator (MS DTC) coordinated transactions between two or more databases.

Event.name: SQL Transaction
Event.description: Tracks Transact-SQL BEGIN, COMMIT, SAVE, and ROLLBACK TRANSACTION statements.

Event.name: Transaction Log
Event.description: Tracks when transactions are written to the transaction log.

Event.name: Exec Prepared SQL
Event.description: ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library has executed a prepared Transact-SQL statement or statements.

Event.name: Prepare SQL
Event.description: ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library has prepared a Transact-SQL statement or statements for use.

Event.name: SQL:BatchCompleted
Event.description: Occurs when a Transact-SQL batch has completed.

Event.name: SQL:BatchStarting
Event.description: Occurs when a Transact-SQL batch has started.

Event.name: SQL:StmtCompleted
Event.description: Occurs when the Transact-SQL statement has completed.

Event.name: SQL:StmtStarting
Event.description: Occurs when the Transact-SQL statement has started.

Event.name: Unprepare SQL
Event.description: ODBC, OLE DB, or DB-Library has unprepared (deleted) a prepared Transact-SQL statement or statements.

Event.name: User Configurable 0
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 1
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 2
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 3
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 4
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 5
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 6
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 7
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 8
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.

Event.name: User Configurable 9
Event.description: Event data defined by the user.
